instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No thunderbolt out of one port
threads.message: So I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with one working thunderbolt port. Port "A" is not working. customer states they plugged something into it and it stopped working. I took the board out, looked around and do not see anything burnt. He thinks the actual port is blown but I don't see how. I see there are 2 <CHIP>CD3210</CHIP>'s for the ports. Is that a good start to check? or should I be looking elsewhere?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No thunderbolt out of one port
threads.message: after looking in the scope i can see one of the pins in black.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No thunderbolt out of one port
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No thunderbolt out of one port
threads.message: It is not. I'm not sure if I should replace the connector or not.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No thunderbolt out of one port
threads.message: Clean the pins first and check for reaction at hot plug detect pin (HPD) when you insert a device.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No thunderbolt out of one port
threads.message: Ok I will try that. What if that doesn't work?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No thunderbolt out of one port
threads.message: Cleaned up the port and it works. We can called thos one closed.
